contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox District DE | name=Rotenburg | state=Lower Saxony | capital=[[Rotenburg an der Wümme|Rotenburg]] | area=2070 | Kreisschlüssel = 03357 | population=163,900 | population_as_of=2003 | density=79 | carsign=ROW | url=[http://www.landkreisrotenburgwuemme.de landkreis<br>rotenburgwuemme.de] | map=Lower Saxony_ROW.svg }}{{Primarysources|article|date=March 2009}}{{Nofootnotes|article|date=March 2009}} '''Rotenburg''' is a [[districts of Germany|district]] (''Landkreis'') in [[Lower Saxony]], [[Germany]]. It is bounded by (from the north and clockwise) the districts of [[Stade (district)|Stade]], [[Harburg]], [[Heidekreis]], [[Verden (district)|Verden]], [[Osterholz]] and [[Cuxhaven (district)|Cuxhaven]]. ==History== In medieval times the region was part of the bishoprics of [[Archbishopric of Bremen|Bremen]] and [[Verden, Germany|Verden]]. After the [[Protestant Reformation]] the bishoprics became secular principalities, colloquially called [[Bremen-Verden]], and finally parts of the [[Kingdom of Hanover]]. The present district was established in 1977 by merging the former districts of Rotenburg and Bremervörde. ==Geography== The [[Wümme River]] runs through the district from east to west. The marshy area to both sides of the river is called the ''Wümmeniederung'' ([[Wümme Depression]]). ==Coat of arms== [[File:Wappen Landkreis Rotenburg Wuemme.png|thumb|right]] The coat of arms displays: * a lion carrying a cross; the lion was the heraldic animal of Hanover, the cross is symbolising the Prince-Bishopric of Verden * two criss-crossed keys from the arms of the Prince-Archbishopric of Bremen ==Towns and municipalities== {| ! align=left width=25%|Towns ! colspan=3 align=center width=75%|[[Amt (political division)|Samtgemeinden]] |- valign=top || #[[Bremervörde]] #[[Rotenburg an der Wümme|Rotenburg]] #[[Visselhövede]] <br> '''Free municipalities'''<br> #[[Gnarrenburg]] #[[Scheeßel]] || *'''1.
